facts.text: Accused was Manager at Kotkhai Branch of Himachal Pradesh State Cooperative Bank; deceased Sunder Lal Chaturvedi was General Manager.
Fire in Kotkhai Branch burnt records; Rs. 10,000 missing; deceased suspended and dismissed accused.
Deceased retired in 1964; started Himprasth Financiers Pvt. Ltd. in 1965 at Nagina Singh Building, Shimla; lived and worked there.
Other directors: Gurucharan Singh, Puran Chand Sood, Kailashi Devi (wife of PW2 I.C. Gupta).
Accused applied for job post-dismissal; appointed Accountant at Finance Company; resigned 31-12-1966 (Exh. P8), accepted 3-1-1967 (Exh. P43) after pay increase denied.

Night of 30-1-1967: Deceased dined at Mansarovar Hotel; met by accused (witnessed by PW7 Romesh Chand); seen together by PW9 Lal Chand at betel shop near Nagina Singh Building, going towards it; last seen alive.
31-1-1967, 9:30 a.m.: PW2 I.C. Gupta found main door bolted; peeped, saw deceased in pool of blood; called police.

SHO PW28 Inder Raj Malik broke open kitchen door; back bathroom door open; deceased had 4 incised wounds (neck, hands); blood-stained key (Ex4) on table, coat button (Ex1) under table, finger impressions on flask neck and glass pane, blood-wiped curtain; 2 key bunches under pillow.
PW6 Des Raj photographed scene, fingerprints after dusting.
PW2, PW8 Amar Chand, PW13 Raidev Krishan reported missing: 2 loan registers, 1 general ledger, 1 cash book, vouchers Apr-Dec 1966, 1 blanket, 1 tea-poy cover, 1 canvas bag.
1-2-1967: PW28 went to Mansarovar Hotel, recorded PW7.

1-2-1967, 11:30 a.m.: PW28 with PW2, PW8 in jeep (driver Roshan Lal); picked PW5 Kala Ram; went to accused's house at Anndale; arrested accused; pursuant to statement (Ex P6), seized sweater, coat, blanket (hidden in niche), boots, socks from accused.

Accused disclosed hiding blood-stained dagger under stone slab below Maidan of Burnt Market near pipe by bakeries; 5 registers in canvas bag under stone at Krishna Nagar bank of Ganda Nala; 8-9 bundles vouchers in tea-poy cloth, blood-stained pants thrown in Ganda Nala.
En route to dagger site, met PW12 Bhag Singh; accused recovered blood-stained dagger (identified by PW11 Ganga Singh as sold to accused on 30-1-1967).
2-2-1967: Recovered canvas bag with 5 registers, tea-poy cloth with vouchers, blood-stained pant from Ganda Nala (Ex P7).

Forensic: Button (Ex1) similar to one missing from accused's coat cuff; human blood on key, dagger, blanket, coat, sweater, pant, shoes, socks; O group on deceased's pajama/shirt; fingerprints on flask/glass match accused (12+ points similarity).

Delhi High Court (Himachal Bench) acquitted accused on 12-8-1969 in Criminal Appeal No. 68/1967 and Murder Reference No. 1/1967; rejected motive, last seen, recoveries under S.27 Evidence Act, fingerprints.
Supreme Court appeal by special leave.

legal_issues.text: Whether circumstantial evidence (motive, last seen with deceased, recoveries of blood-stained articles and dagger pursuant to accused's statement under S.27 Evidence Act, fingerprints matching accused, coat button) proves guilt beyond reasonable doubt.
Admissibility and reliability of recoveries under S.27 Evidence Act; whether witnesses independent.
Reliability of fingerprint expert report without examination of expert.
Whether information leading to discovery of witness (dagger seller PW11) admissible under S.27.

petitioner_arguments.text: Circumstantial evidence complete chain: motive from dismissal and denied re-employment; last seen with deceased; fingerprints, button prove presence; recoveries of blood-stained articles, dagger, missing items pursuant to voluntary statement; forensic confirmation.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 27 Evidence Act; chain of circumstances

petitioner_arguments.text: Witnesses reliable; PW2 etc. properly identified missing items; no planting as accused role unknown initially; fingerprint report admissible under S.510 CrPC.

respondent_arguments.text: No motive: suspension by bank authorities, not personal; re-employed later; no grievance.
Last seen does not mean entered building together or present at murder time.

Recoveries suspicious: non-independent witnesses (PW2,5,8,13 connected); possible planting; statement amounts to confession, not recorded before Magistrate; delay in some recoveries; coat/sweater not proved accused's.
Fingerprints suspicious: only accused's found, noticed by non-experts early; report lacks details.
PW2 had motive to murder for appropriating money/accounts; witnesses connected to him.
Signed blank papers for memos; no recoveries on 1-2-67.

court_reasoning.text: Circumstantial evidence must form complete chain; each link credible; prosecution proves beyond reasonable doubt.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Evidence dependable if no link missing.

court_reasoning.text: Motive exists from denied re-employment despite initial employment; though weak alone, supports chain.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Accused nursed grievance against deceased's refusal.

court_reasoning.text: Last seen with deceased at 9:30-9:45 pm 30-1-67; combined with fingerprints/button proves presence at murder time.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No evidence of prior visit leaving prints.

court_reasoning.text: Recoveries under S.27 admissible; witnesses sufficiently independent; no legal requirement for different witnesses per recovery; PW5 not subservient.
Information leading to PW11 not admissible under S.27 as no material fact discovered from witness; but conduct admissible under S.8.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Discovery must be material object, not witness identity.

court_reasoning.text: Account books/vouchers/pant recovery unreliable due to delay/police prior knowledge.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Not discovered pursuant to fresh info.

court_reasoning.text: Fingerprint report reliable (12+ points); admissible under S.510 CrPC without expert exam unless challenged.
Coat button matches accused's; blood on his clothes/blanket/dagger; blanket fits cold night.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Direct clue to presence and guilt.

court_reasoning.text: No motive for PW2; friendly relations; accounts show no large cash; witnesses not implicated.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Defence suggestion creates no reasonable doubt.

court_reasoning.text: High Court perversely rejected credible evidence; SC interferes with acquittal.

holdings.text: Circumstantial evidence proves accused guilty of murder under S.302 IPC beyond reasonable doubt.
Recoveries of sweater, coat, blanket, shoes, socks, dagger pursuant to S.27 statement admissible and reliable.
Fingerprint evidence accepted; report under S.510 CrPC sufficient.
Information re PW11 inadmissible under S.27 but conduct under S.8.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Madras v. Vaidyanatha Iyer
precedents_cited.relevance: SC power to interfere with acquittal findings if perverse.
Limits of S.27 Evidence Act: only info leading to discovery of material fact admissible.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ramkishan Mithanlal Sharma v. State of Bombay

precedents_cited.relevance: Fact under S.27 is material, not mental.

precedents_cited.case_name: Public Prosecutor v. India China Lingiah
precedents_cited.relevance: Discovery of witness via info not within S.27.
Discovery of witness via info not within S.27.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Penal Code
statutes_cited.relevance: Offence of murder; conviction and sentence to life imprisonment.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Evidence Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Admissibility of discovery statements; conduct; definition of fact.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Criminal Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Investigation; panch witnesses for searches; expert reports as evidence.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court set aside High Court acquittal, convicted accused under S.302 IPC, sentenced to life imprisonment based on reliable circumstantial evidence including motive, last seen, fingerprints, matching button, blood-stained recoveries.

key_quotes.text: "circumstantial evidence consists in various links in a chain, which if complete, leads to the undoubted conclusion that the accused and accused alone could have committed the offence"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines standard for circumstantial evidence proof.

key_quotes.text: "the benefit of doubt to which the accused is entitled is reasonable doubt-the doubt which rational thinking men will reasonably, honestly and conscientiously entertain"
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "In an investigation under Sec. 157 the recoveries could be proved even by the solitary evidence of the Investigating Officer if his evidence could otherwise be believed."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: No mandatory independent witnesses for recoveries.
